Description: Fragment of an Attic wheel-made black-glazed pottery lamp: the upper rounded part of the front right side of the body with a ridged rim sloping into the wide filling-orifice. The nozzle is broken away, but part of the wick-hole remains. Covered in black glaze; inscription on wall. Fine orange fabric reduced to grey-brown in places near nozzle.
Curator's comments: Parallel from Athens (Howland 1958, Type 24A). Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals. Princeton.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q52)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 104)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 705, no. 636?)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.34) (Phase 1)
